IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Pasadena Community Foundation builds and preserves permanently endowed charitable funds, provides grants and assistance to nurture and strengthen community organizations, serves donors to meet their philanthropic goals and promotes and participates in community partnerships.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Pasadena Community Foundation builds and preserves permanently endowed charitable funds, provides grants and assistance to nurture and strengthen community organizations, serves donors to meet their philanthropic goals and promotes and participates in community partnerships. These grants include PCF, Donor Advised and Field of Interest Grants.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: To support the administration and grant making programs of PCF and to provide perpetual support for causes important to donors.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Foundation is exempt from taxation under Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3) and California Revenue and Taxation Code Section 23701d. Generally accepted accounting principles provide accounting and disclosure guidance about positions taken by an organization in its tax returns that might be uncertain. Management has considered its tax positions and believes that all of the positions taken by the Foundation in its federal and state exempt organization tax returns are more likely than not to be sustained upon examination. The Foundation returns are subject to examination by federal and state taxing authorities, generally for three and four years, respectively, after they are filed.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The Pasadena Community Foundation monitors the use of grant monies as follows: All agencies are verified to be 501c3 public charities and/or grant eligible before grants are awarded. A grant award fund agreement and/or grant letter and report worksheet are sent to the grantees. The grant award fund agreement and/or grant letter explicitly states the purpose of the grant award or restrictions of the grant and specifies expectations for compliance including use of funds, timing, policy on any unspent funds and reporting requirements. The report worksheet requests receipts for capital purchases and/or key accomplishments for program grants. This report is reviewed by PCF staff and if any discrepancies are found PCF asks the agency for reimbursement of funds. These reports are tracked throughout the year and agencies are disqualified for future grants if reports have not been completed. In the case of unrestricted donations to charitable organizations through donor advised funds, grant reports are not required.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Governing Body Review of 990 Process: Audit Committee meets with outside auditor to go over the 990. Upon review, Audit Committee Chair presents any findings and leads discussions if any, and whole board approves 990 to be filed.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: PCF has board members update their conflict of interest paperwork yearly.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Determining Compensation of Executive Director and other key employees Process: The Council on Foundation does an annual survey of salaries for non-profits throughout the nation. PCF participates in the survey. The results are compiled by the Council and distributed to all participants. A separate salary survey is conducted by the League of California Foundations. PCF also participates in this survey. Once the results have been distributed, PCF staff compiles data and presents to the Finance Committee along with overall budgets and salary recommendations for the fiscal year. The Executive Committee reviews the salary for staff in Executive session of the Board meeting.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: PCF provides its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, financial statements and Form 990 available to the public upon request.
